result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

[ma] Case called at 2:36 PM {This hearing is being conducted via Zoom videoconferencing.} 
Defendant Rachel L. Kopp in court, in custody.  Attorney Shunette Torna Campbell appeared by zoom for Rachel L. Kopp.  Attorney Monica Hall in court for State of Wisconsin. 

On Defendant's Motion for Bond Modification: 
--Arguments in opposition given by DA Hall
--Arguments given by Atty Campbell 

The Court denies motion to modify bond. 
recess: 2:46pm
Letter in Support of Bond Modification

[MK] cases #20CM164,  #21CF467, #21CF652, #21CM162, #21CM255,  #22CF406 called at 10:14am [clerk's inserted note:  Ms. Kopp's Case #22CF135 was called immediately before these cases were called, in a hearing along with the Co-Defendant in that specific case]
Defendant Rachel Kopp in court, in custody, with Attorney Shunette Campbell Hunter.  ADA  Krysta Parson in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

In Case #21CF467 and #21CF652 and #22CF406 Waivers of Preliminary Hearing are held: 
Ms. Kopp waives her right to preliminary Hearing.  The Court accepts this wavier and bonds her over for trial. 

After Attorney Campbell Hunter indicates that the Defense is requesting bond amount reduction [Case #22CF406], the Court indicates that it will hear the Motion later today, and the Court would like for documentation to be filed that would corroborate the Defense assertion that Ms. Kopp would be entering a treatment program. 
recess 10:19am  

NEXT:  (1) Attorney Campbell Hunter will file a Motion to Modify Bond [Case #22CF406 is the applicable case] shortly,  (2) Bond Motion Hearing today at 2:30pm [Case #22CF406 only],  (2)  Arraignment in Cases #21CF467, #21CF652, #22CF135, and #22CF406, and Status Conference on that remaining cases on October 24th at 9:00am; Attorney Campbell Hunter may appear by Zoom Conference for this hearing if she wishes

Request to appear by phone or Zoom
SPD Order Appointing Counsel - Att Campbell Hunter
Preliminary hearing on September 16, 2022 at 08:45 am.

[MK] case called at 1:41pm 
Defendant Rachel L. Kopp appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Cassi Nelson (the PD will appoint counsel). Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties. However after Ms. Kopp makes a statement, Attorney Nelson requests scheduling at the next available date. 

The Court requires a $750 Cash Bond with no special conditions.
recess 1:48pm. 

NEXT: (1) clerk- add the Jefferson Public Defenders Office to the mailing matrix,  (2) Preliminary Hearing on September 16th at 8:45am
